intro: Croixia microphylla, commonly known as the lesser crocus, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Iridaceae family, which includes irises and gladioli. The plant produces small, delicate flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in early spring. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Croixia microphylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
